headline: Five charged in Schuylkill County drug ring
author: South Schuylkill News
sentences: “Increasingly, we’re seeing fentanyl replace heroin as the dominant opioid here in Pennsylvania, because of its low cost – as little as 79 cents a dose.” Attorney General Josh Shapiro said in a statement announcing the arrests.

Five people have been arrested for alleged roles in the distribution and trafficking of fentanyl and methamphetamine in Schuylkill County and the surrounding region, the state attorney general’s office announced April 19.
